intro: Sabia callosa, commonly known as the rough sabia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it adapted to harsh, dry environments. Sabia callosa is often used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
